summary: The ABLE Employment Flexibility Act (H.R. 4644) amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow employers to contribute to ABLE (Achieving a Better Life Experience) accounts on behalf of eligible employees, in lieu of contributions to a defined contribution retirement plan. The bill details how these contributions are treated for tax and non-discrimination purposes, including for means-tested federal programs. It also clarifies employer contributions to ABLE accounts, provides for regulations and model amendments from the Treasury Secretary, and includes provisions for eligible individuals’ use of funds. The legislation aims to help working individuals with disabilities and encourages employers to support their employees’ ABLE plans.
